Volibear isn't a war god, and he won't be. He's a storm god.

Have you read his short bio? It was released in November of 2017 so it is truestable to some extent, and it leaves pretty clear that he is higly related to war:
> The thunderous demigod known as the Thousand-Pierced Bear is the battle-spirit of the Freljord. Thousands of years of constant and bitter wars, fought in the coldest winters, have hardened Volibear into a truly indomitable force, hurling bolts of lightning from the highest peaks—and when snowy tempests rage down, it can only mean that he is on the attack once more. Any who dare to face him may find themselves joining his fierce army of Ursine warriors… assuming they do not fall victim to his savage claws.

> [{quoted}](name=Atgo,realm=EUW,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=EkUVEaF1,comment-id=00050001,timestamp=2018-10-30T19:10:34.422+0000)

> Have you read his short bio? It was released in November of 2017 so it is truestable to some extent, and it leaves pretty clear that he is higly related to war:

Fighting in wars doesn't make you a war god, or practically every god that we know of would be considered one.

Volibear is the personification of War, much like Ornn is the personification of Creation/Craftsmanship and Anivia the personification of Life/Death/Rebirth. We are still missing the a few brothers and sisters - in particular the [Seal Sister](https://universe.leagueoflegends.com/en_US/story/tales-of-ornn/)).
***
Think of it like this. In different cultures we have different deities that represent similar things. Nords, greeks, romans, egyptians, mayans, etc. Those polytheistic religions had overlapping deities.
Volibear won't take Pantheon's place, but we can say Volibear is to Freljord what Pantheon is to Shurima.
######However, Pantheon are something else.
***
FYI this is how Volibear is described:
> “No,” said Ornn, for he wanted no part in Volibear’s warmongering.
> ...
> This was exactly what Volibear wanted. For centuries, he had grown jealous of the love the Hearthblood freely gave to his brother. It enraged the war-bear.

"Warmonger" and "war-bear". It's really cut and dry.

It still seems likely that he becomes a war god.
You say "he is not a war god, just a storm god", but look at Ornn.

Ornn is a personification of vulcanoes, representing the elements fire and earth (like every demigod of the Freljord represents some elemental power, Anivia being ice, Volibear storm, sister seal is most likely water).
But his theme goes beyond that. He is worshipped as a god for craftsmen and artificers, he is the godly blacksmith.

I think something similar will be the case for Volibear, he will be the god of storms and lightning, but **also** be the _god warrior_, worshipped by warriors in the Freljord and seen as the deity of war.

To be fair,he is called a "battle-spirit",so I'd say it is possible that he'll be considered the demigod of battles in general,not just war.

This would really help to make him stand out next to Pantheon and Aatrox(though the war-theme was heavily toned down in Aatroxs VGU anyway).
Ornn isn't just a fire god but a forge god too. So why can't Voli be both.

> [{quoted}](name=Neamean,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=EkUVEaF1,comment-id=00050000,timestamp=2018-10-30T18:27:07.757+0000)
>
> Ornn isn't just a fire god but a forge god too. So why can't Voli be both.

Well, the forge is an extension of his fire god aspects, so it's interconnected. Volibear's storm god characteristics are not really suited for war, and given his only followers being cultists, and that the Freljord tribes don't revere him (despite being a war riddled region), it's pretty safe to assume he has nothing to do with war. Plus, as many have noted, it overlaps Pantheon too much.
In Ornn's story and bio, we see that several tribes DO worship and revere Volibear.

The concept of a storm can easily be connected to war. Thunder being war drums for one. 

Heck they can even goes as far as to say that, "at the end of every war/storm is a ravage land" it would still make sense. 

Seeing how lacking Voli is in the lore department they can use this chance to reinvent him. They can easily draw parallel between storm and war.
